description: An anti-smoking advocate says the decision to leave menthol cigarettes on the market "prioritizes politics over lives, especially Black lives."
title: Biden administration abandons plan to ban menthol cigarettes, citing 'feedback'

description: There are parallels between the two high-profile events, most starkly the proliferation of similar protests around the country. But key differences set them apart.
title: In Columbia University's protests of 1968 and 2024, what's similar — and different

description: With nearly 5,000 cases reported so far this year — and concerns about a new strain — the Democratic Republic of Congo is considering the declaration of a public health emergency.
title: DRC is seeing its worst mpox outbreak — but has no vaccines or treatments yet. Why?

description: The U.S. will reinstate Obama-era regulations for internet service providers that promise fast, reliable and fair internet speeds for all consumers. What happened when those rules were taken away?
title: Net neutrality is back: U.S. promises fast, safe and reliable internet for all

description: Buckingham Palace hasn't said what type of cancer Charles had or if he's finished treatment. It said he'll make a public visit to a cancer clinic Tuesday and will welcome Japan's emperor in June.
title: King Charles III is returning to royal duties after his cancer diagnosis

description: The newborn died after five days in an incubator. Her family was killed in an air strike. UNICEF says 13,000 children have been killed in Gaza since Oct. 7, with thousands more orphaned and wounded.
title: A baby girl born orphaned and premature after an Israeli airstrike in Gaza has died

description: The flight was forced to make an emergency return to JFK airport after the crew observed issues related to the right wing emergency exit slide, as well as a sound near the right wing.
title: A Delta Air Lines flight makes an emergency return following concerns with plane wing

description: Entrepreneurial Swifties are selling crafty products inspired by Taylor Swift's music and style. Swift herself has been known to send notes and even homemade gifts to creative super-fans.
title: Taylor Swift fans mean business with Tortured Poet soap, Eras yarn, Kelce cookies

description: Hundreds of students have been arrested at pro-Palestinian protests at colleges nationwide. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Antony Blinken in an exclusive interview about U.S.-China relations.
title: Campus protests over Gaza could affect graduation; Steve Inkseep interviews Blinken

description: Five of the six conservatives spent much of their lives in the Beltway, working in the White House and Justice Department, seeing their administrations as targets of unfair harassment by Democrats.
title: Trump's immunity arguments and the experiences of the justices who might support it

description: In Gaza's southernmost city, where more than a million Palestinians have sought shelter and where aid groups have centralized operations, worries have grown over a possible Israeli military operation.
title: What to know about a possible Israeli military offensive in Rafah

description: Students and others are protesting Israel's war against Hamas in Gaza and, in some cases, their school's investments in Israel. Presidents at several schools face calls to resign amid the protests.
title: More than 500 people have been arrested at pro-Palestinian protests at colleges

description: Hundreds of students have been arrested for participating in pro-Palestinian protests in recent days. And some schools, like Columbia and GW, have given them deadlines to dismantle their encampments.
title: Pro-Palestinian campus protesters face looming deadlines and risk of arrest

description: The United Methodist Church has voted to restructure itself in a way that could allow for LGBTQ+ clergy and same-sex weddings.
title: United Methodist Church begins reorganization over LGBTQ+ issues

description: Florida passed in 2023 one of the strictest immigration laws in the country, and now businesses struggle to find workers in several sectors of the economy
title: A year later, Florida businesses say the state's immigration law dealt a huge blow.

description: This wild case emphasizes the serious potential for criminal misuse of artificial intelligence that experts have been warning about for some time, one professor said.
title: A Baltimore teacher is accused of using AI to make his boss appear racist

description: Twyla Stallworth, a woman from Andalusia, Ala., filed a federal lawsuit against the city, its police department and Grant Barton, the police officer involved in the incident.
title: Alabama woman who says police assaulted her after calling 911 files federal lawsuit

description: David Pecker, the former publisher of the National Enquirer, told prosecutors he killed stories that potentially could have hurt Donald Trump during his run for the White House in 2016.
title: Former tabloid publisher details actions on behalf of Trump ahead of 2016 election

description: Intelligence officials and lawmakers describe the Chinese-owned social media app as a national security threat. But they haven't shared that evidence with the public.
title: China's influence operations against the U.S. are bigger than TikTok

description: Plus, Tesla's next move, Taylor's new record and why zoo animals (sometimes) get weird during eclipses.
title: Where can you call an artist on a lobster? Find out in the quiz

description: Five of the 31 tanks have already been lost to Russian attacks in Ukraine, where the use of surveillance and hunter-killer drones had made it difficult for them to operate.
title: Ukraine pulls U.S.-provided Abrams tanks from the front lines over drone threats

description: Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez left Spain in suspense after announcing he may step down because of what he called an "unprecedented" smear campaign against his wife.
title: Here's why Spain's prime minister Pedro Sánchez is considering stepping down

description: Prosecutor Rafael Curruchiche said that the complaint filed by an unidentified foreigner had raised serious concerns because it involved allegations of abuse of children.
title: Guatemalan AG raids Save the Children office over a migrant children rights complaint

description: The lawsuit comes after federal regulations were published on implementing the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act. The language means workers can ask for time off to obtain and recover from an abortion.
title: 17 states challenge federal rules entitling workers to accommodations for abortion
